meanings.definition: Take (a position of power or importance) illegally or by force.
meanings.sent1: The villain tried to usurp the king's throne by force.
meanings.sent2: The dictator managed to usurp control of the country through deceit.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat tried to usurp the dog's favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious student aimed to usurp the title of class president.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to usurp the sky, blocking out the sun's rays.

meanings.definition: Seize (a throne, power, etc.) without legal right.
meanings.sent1: The rebel army planned to usurp the throne from the corrupt king.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer sought to usurp magical powers beyond his own.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to usurp the bird's nest for its own use.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious entrepreneur aimed to usurp the market share from competitors.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder seemed to usurp the peaceful silence of the night.
